abstract: Former New York City Police Dept Commissioner Raymond W Kelly, while promoting release of memoir Vigilance: My Life Serving America and Protecting Its Empire City, blames Mayor Bill de Blasio's curbs on stop-and-frisk tactics for rise in killings in city; says nationwide increase in murders is due to disengagement by police everywhere; book discusses policing policies, foiled terrorist plots and efforts to fortify new World Trade Center.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Kelly, whose memoir comes out on Tuesday, said the administration’s curtailing of police stops in New York had led to more violence.

headline.main: Raymond Kelly, Ex-Police Commissioner, Blames Mayor de Blasio for Rise in Killings
headline.print_headline: Kelly Says Mayor’s Curbs on Stop-and-Frisk Tactics Led to Increase in Killings
